text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

Today I am gonna be making something I got
so many requests for.

You guys were saying: Ro, please make the
Nerdy Nummies Cookie! How did you
make that cute little cookie?

So today, I am gonna show you how to make
the little Nerdy Nummies Smart Cookie!
Let’s get started!

The 1st thing that we’re gonna do is actually
make the glasses, we’re gonna start

with decoration because cookie icing takes
about 6-8 hours to dry, I did mine

the night before, so you might want to do
this the night before.

But what you’re gonna need is… I made
this little template, I’ll put a link down

below to the PDF Version, or the JPEG, so
that if you’d like the template, you

can download that. And you’re gonna need
a cookie pan and a piece of wax paper.

And then you’re just gonna put the template
down into the pan, tape it down.

1 on the top, 1 on the bottom, and then you’re
gonna take your piece of wax paper,

put it on the top, and you’re also gonna
tape that down so it won’t move.

You’re gonna need 2 colors of cookie icing,
black and pink, and I’ve just put the

cookie icing into a plastic bag, and I put
a number 2 tip on the bottom.
And I have tape on me… Hmmm-hmmm!

OK, and now you’re just gonna trace the
outline of the glasses.

Once you’ve drawn all your little glasses,
ah they look so cute!

We are just gonna let them sit, put them aside
for 5-6 hours and don’t put them

in the fridge and don’t put them in the
oven, just let them sit out somewhere

dry at room temperature, and while these are
drying, and they’re hardening and

setting, we are gonna make our chocolate chip
cookies.

The things you will need to make these yummy
chocolate chip cookies is going to be:

2 cups of flour, 3/4 cup of regular sugar,
3/4 cup of brown sugar,

1 teaspoon of salt, 1 teaspoon of baking soda,
2 eggs, 12 ounces of semi-sweet

chocolate chips, yum yum yum yum, which also
equals, uh, 2 cups,

2 sh-ticks of butter, which equals 1 cup,
and a teaspoon of vanilla extract.

I’m also using a whisk and a Kitchenaid,
but if you don’t have, uh, a Kitchenaid

stand mixer, you can just use an electric
hand mixer.

OR, you can get a wooden spoon and really
mix it up yourself!

The 1st thing that we’re going to do is
combined our flour, and our salt, and
our baking soda.
Dee-dee-dee-dee-dee-dee-dee!

I love these little things, they’re, they’re
like rubber!

Arr ber-ber-ber! I found these at like World
Market, these are so funny.

OK, and then you’re gonna take your whisk,
mix all your dry ingredients
together in this bowl.

Now in this bowl, we’re going to cream together
our butter, our sugar, and brown

sugar. And last but not least, a teaspoon
of vanilla extract.
Lock, and loaded!

Dig-uh dig-uh dig-uh dig-uh dig-uh dig-uh
dig-uh!

Once that’s mixed, you’re gonna add 2
eggs!

Then you’re gonna mix it up again, and then once
the eggs are combined

you’re gonna slowly add your flour, just
slowly shake it in there.
Oh yeah! Huh-huh!
COOKIE DOUGH!

Alright, smells so good! Our cookie dough
is ready for us to fold in the chocolate chips!

So, what you’re gonna do is you’re gonna
fold in all of your chocolate chips,

this is 12 ounces. But I’ve set aside a
little handful and these are for

the details on the chocolate chip. So just
take handful and set a few

aside for after the cookies bake. Trust me!
It’ll be so cute!
Just pour in the rest!
Oh! Chocolate!
Oh, I, I opened it a really… Horrible way!
I make it rain! I make it rain!

Alright, now you’re just gonna fold in all
of these yummy chocolate chips!
This looks so good!

Our chocolate chip cookie dough is all ready
to bake, so now you’re just gonna take,

I got a tablespoon measurer, and my baking
sheet, and I’m just gonna scoop a
big tablespoon serving.
Oh ewp! Look at him he’s excited!
And you’re just gonna put it on the sheet.

Leave a couple of inches on each side of the
cookie, because these cookies will
flatten out and expand.

Now you’re gonna heat your oven to 375 and
you’re gonna bake these cookies

for about 9 minutes, or until they turn golden
brown!

After your cookies are done baking, you’re
gonna take them out of the oven,

and give them about a minute or two to cool,
but while they’re still warm,

we’re gonna put on those extra chocolate
chips that we set aside right here.

The Nerdy Nummies cookie has 6 distinctive
chocolate chips, so I’ve just placed them

on the top like this. I’ve done them to
these cookies,
but I left this 1 so you could see.

Just make sure you put them on the top and
the very bottom, because you want

to make sure you leave room for the glasses…
Ding! In the middle!

Now you’re gonna take your cookie icing
glasses, and I’m taking a sharp

knife, and we’re gonna remove them
from the wax paper.

This is the part where you want to be really
gentle, they are a little bit
fragile, so just be gentle.

And then, you’re just gonna place them in
the middle of the cookie!

Now the last step is you’re gonna take your
black and pink cookie icings,

I’ve put them in plastic bags, frosting
bags, and I put number 2 tips at the end,

these little metal tips. And we’re just
gonna draw the little eyeballs
and the cheeks on every cookie!
Ta-da!

Here are our Nerdy Nummies smart cookies!
They’re so cute!

Thanks you guys for suggesting it. This chocolate
chip recipe is super yummy
and very easy, so I would say it is easy mode!

If you have any other suggestions for any
other Nerdy Nummies, please let me know,

leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen!

Also, you can follow me on Facebook, Twitter,
Instagram, Tumblr, because I’ll post

lots of pictures of these little cookies,
and, I love to post your pictures!

So if you make these Nerdy Nummies cookies,
please take pictures and send

them to me! I get a big kick out of seeing
all the cookies!
It just makes my day!
Alright, thanks you guys!
Bye-bye!
